DOC.HEAD: Homeless Ousted from Under Downtown Freeway
DOC.TEXT: Shivering people were moved from under tattered blankets by police and city officials who said they would enforce trespassing laws if the homeless return to their makeshift camp under a downtown freeway. Most bundled up meager belongings Saturday and agreed to be taken to indoor shelters. Others from the group of about a dozen walked off, saying they would return. If they do, they will be given a second chance to find other shelter, or they will be jailed for trespassing, said Bob Dean, director of the mayor's citizen assistance office. ``It's damn cold under here. They shouldn't be here,'' Dean said, adding that many of the campers need help for alcohol, drug or medical problems. Dean said a lack of toilet facilities under the freeway is causing a health hazard, and that the small fires the campers set could spread.
